title: A Study of Marians character through the Relationship of four different men in cathers a lost lady
abstract: This thesis stresses on the study of Marian’s character through her relationship with four different men in Gather’s A Lost Lady. The writer wants to find out what kind of a lady Marian Forrester is, so that, she becomes a lost lady. Moreover, the writer will describe the character of Marian after drawing conclusion fi'om her relationship with four different men. The writer only wants to find out Marian’s character in A Lost Lady through the relationship with four different men such as, Frank Eliinger, Ivy Peters, Niel Herbert and Captain Forrester with Marian. Besides, the writer applies literary device namely characterization to analyze Marian’s characters. Finally, through the analysis, it is shown that the main character does not have the power to live without men and she really depends on men’s attention and she is also too naive and innocent to face her life. The relationship with Niel Herbert, Frank Eliinger, Captain Forrester and Ivy Peters will help the writer to describe the character of Marian.
contributors: Jenny Mochtar Djundjung (Advisor 1); Julia Eka Rini (Advisor 2); Liliek Soelistyo (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION--20TH CENTURY--STUDY AND TEACHING; CATHER, WILLA, 1873-1947. A LOST LADY-STUDY AND TEACHING
